content.text:
## New Plugins

Eliza OS has added several new plugins to enhance functionality:

- **Blockchain Plugins**: Added support for Ton, Holdstation swap, Ethstorage, Sei, Lit, Mina blockchain, Ankr, Zerion, Form chain, Mind Network, and Solana web3.js V2 with automated LPing on Orca
- **AI and Automation**: Added Imgflip plugin for meme generation, intelligent email evaluation and automation, Bittensor BitMind API integration, and Amazon Bedrock as an LLM provider
- **Financial Tools**: Added Moralis plugin and Quick Intel plugin for token security analysis
- **Other Additions**: Added Edriziai Startup Mentor AI Assistant and DCAP plugin

## Bug Fixes

Several bug fixes have been implemented:

- Fixed TON plugin build issues and general TON plugin fixes
- Removed sensitive content from plugin-bootstrap to prevent API alerts
- Fixed Twitter parsing issues including homeTimeline name parse bug
- Fixed topics formatting bug in composeState
- Resolved ethers/viem issue in Mind Network plugin
- Fixed DTS error mismatch in AI-SDK Mistral model
- Made template message footer more explicit
- Fixed path issues across files
- Fixed goal updating bug in the goal evaluator's handler of plugin-bootstrap
- Resolved @ai-sdk/provider version conflicts

## Feature Enhancements

Significant feature improvements have been added:

- Added debug scripts and fixed transfers for TON plugin
- Restricted Discord bot to respond only in allowed channels
- Implemented minimal workflow to resolve ephemeral check
- Added biome automation via Python with reporting
- Moved cleanJsonResponse to parsing
- Improved Twitter parsing
- Added swap & improvements for MultiversX plugin
- Created MongoDB adapter
- Added basic Alexa skill notification
- Added turbo cache and created /.turbo/config.json

## Documentation and Testing

Improvements to documentation and testing infrastructure:

- Added documentation on configuring secrets for multi-agent workflows
- Added one-click deployment to docs
- Added source example links for core/evaluators
- Implemented test config and test coverage for client-eliza-home
- Updated to latest allora-sdk version in the Allora Plugin
- Added test config and tests for plugin abstract
- Added Hyperliquid environment variables to env example
- Updated tokenContract.ts in plugin-coinbase
- Allowed custom TEE log path

categories.title: Technology Transforming Finance and AI Development Updates

content.text: The NYSE trading floor has undergone a dramatic transformation due to technological advancement. Once bustling with approximately 5,000 people, it now operates with just around 300 individuals, serving more as a symbolic backdrop than an active trading hub. Since the mid-2000s, algorithms have taken over trading operations, and now anyone can access 24/7 capital markets and state-of-the-art AI models with autonomous trading capabilities. This shift represents a powerful example of how technology has fundamentally reshaped the financial industry.

There's significant development happening in the open-source AI space. The Deepseek-R1 model, which cost approximately $5.5 million to train, is generating excitement as an MIT-licensed alternative to proprietary models like O1/Sonnet. Meanwhile, projects like Eliza are being developed to provide AI fact-checking capabilities for social media posts, representing a collaboration between open-source developers, DAO participants, AI researchers, and cryptocurrency enthusiasts.

A project update thread mentions significant development activity with 125,000 holders, hundreds of new contributors, and approximately 600 pull requests merged in the last 30 days, despite some community members asking for more updates.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several users have reported issues related to Twitter integration in the elizaOS/eliza repository. Issue #2745 questions whether a Twitter API is needed, while issue #2754 reports a bug where image vision/description functionality isn't working in the Twitter client. Issue #2776 is a query about Twitter user tracking capabilities.

Build and deployment issues have been reported. Issue #2727 describes a failure during 'pnpm build' with client#build, and issue #2729 notes that the @elizaos/plugin-rabbi-trader package hasn't been published to npm. There are also feature requests for one-click deployment options on both Render.com (issue #2780) and DigitalOcean (issue #2779).

Feature enhancement requests include issue #2787 for adding a GUI feature, and issue #2785 requesting improved INFO logging for successful RAG knowledge vector matches. Additionally, issue #2746 is a general help request from user 1Eskor without specific details.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and plugins are being developed for the elizaOS/eliza repository. GitHub integration is being enhanced through two PRs by snobbee: PR #2767 adds unique rooms functionality to GitHub plugins, while PR #2752 implements multi-user support for the GitHub client.

New plugins under development include:
- A Form chain plugin (PR #2728 by tmarwen)
- An Ankr plugin (PR #2773 by AIFlowML)
- An intelligent email evaluation and automation plugin (PR #2709 by Cooops)
- A plugin for biome automation via Python with reporting capabilities (PR #2733 by AIFlowML)

Additionally, there's ongoing work on Commerce plugin cleanup and testing (PR #2790 by monilpat) and a 'plugin-feel' feature that's still in progress (PR #867 by boyaloxer).

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 24-25, 2025, there were 24 new pull requests with 20 merged, 17 new issues created, and 64 active contributors. The following day (January 25-26, 2025) saw 16 new pull requests with 29 merged, 6 new issues, and 42 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with a total of 40 new PRs, 49 merged PRs, 23 new issues, and continued engagement from dozens of contributors across the two-day period.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
